phrases: Send the lost promises to the stars
My memories will not fade away
yotsuba no clover sagashinagara kimi no kao
I steal a glance at you as we look for four-leaf clovers,
chirari nusumi mite wa me o sorasu
yasashii ame wa furu watashitachi no ue ni
The gentle rain falls above our heads
surechigau hito no kazu dake dramatic ni naru no
as it becomes as dramatic as the number of people passing by
I wonder if we will ever be able to
itsuka mata aeru hi ga kurukashira
reunite with those precious things that were broken
The scars that were left behind will not go away
It is been almost a week since I started aimlessly pedaling my bicycle.
I withdrew some money and bought a lot of things from the 100 yen shop.
The compass, the map of Japan, and the wristwatch are especially useful.
With these, I can finally travel with a plan in mind.
What surprised me the most on my journey was how quickly you become hungry when you have been pedaling the entire day.
I quickly lose strength if I do not eat at least five times a day.
I learned very well that the food you eat acts as gasoline for your body.
What surprised me was that there are not many places to camp out in Japan.
There is a lot of open space, but people cannot sleep restfully unless they are by a tree or a wall.
It is something I learned for the first time on my travels.
It is rather stressful to get water where there are not any public facilities.
Usually, people gradiously share some with me.
No, no, what are you talking about?
Of course, events like this are not rare either.
I have had to ask many different people, but I get nervous every time.
Homes and the people that live in them resemble each other.
Where in the world did you come from?
Not only water, but even food?
If you were to liken me to a house, I wonder what I would look like...
I hope I look like that one...
I want to become something like that.
You have outdone yourself again, Yamada-san.
Maybe we should go with the milk white?
But the ash gray is hard to pass up...
Miwako-san, it is a text message for you.
I still have not seen the dunes.
He just abandoned all his work!
Yamada-san, please send him a message to encourage him, too.
Oh, but I do not have a cell phone...
That is right, you do not have one...
Then I will send one for you.
I am sure it is tough, but please watch your health and do your best with your job in Tottori.
Is not there something you want to say to him?
Like about how he went to Tottori without telling you anything?
If he is going to be gone in Tottori for half a year, he should have just told me when I saw him the other day...
Miwako-san, you do not need to type all that!
You do not need to type all that, got it.
What are you doing feeling pressured over a kid?
But it looks like there might be a chance for you.
Really now... she is a terrifying person.
I heard that you did not submit a piece to the Marine Light Exhibit or the Four Seasons Exhibit?
You could have become the youngest person to win an award.
What is the point if you do not do it now?
You have been invited to study at an art school in Italy, but I hear that you are going back to the countryside after graduation?
Art is not so easy that you can improve your skills out in the countryside.
You have the ability to make anything possible, if you just gave it a try.
That is why she is returning to the countryside.
So... please do not think of her that way.
Kouda-sensei, you see, has been through a lot.
She wanted to become a painter, studied alone in Paris for many years, and worked so hard she became ill.
So I think she is agitated by your talent.
Hagu, I think Kouda-sensei's opinion is correct.
But I do not think that her opinion is absolute.
What is important is that no matter what path you choose, you do not make an excuse out of it.
My savings are almost half gone.
I cannot move forward without money.
When my money is half gone is when I have to turn around.
What will I find if I keep going like this?
These thoughts plagued my mind as I went along my travels.
boku ga umareta tokoro sa doko darou
I was born there... but where is it now?
It is where you were born
It looks like we were able to meet
kyou no hi yukai ni sugiteyuku
Today is fun and passing by
mou sayonara da yo kimi no koto wa wasurenai
It is time to say goodbye now, I will not forget about you
Passing through the tunnel, I came to a really beautiful spot.
It is the first tourist spot that I have visited on my trip.
Even though it is a place you would normally come to on a bullet train from Tokyo,
I made it here on a bicycle...
I am a little... just a little... proud of myself.
It is been a while since I have been to a Buddhist temple...
For those who are here by themselves, please use the ticket vending machine.
This is frustrating... it is right in front of me, but I can only see the gate...
Although the gate by itself is plenty impressive...
For an age without fret-saws or slicers...
Now that I think about it, my mind was only on pedaling, and I had not been looking at the scenery, like temples.
I should start looking at temples from now on.
Since I have come this far, after all...
Your stomach can rumble all it wants but you are not getting any!
Well, I... was not thinking of that...
I made that bento with all my heart.
To be blunt, your bento has too much rice.
And there are too little sides.
You fill the damn thing with just pickles.
Make some real sides, like something fried.
Actually, the green cayenne pepper is too hot!
Or rather, it might be more accurate to call us temple carpenters.
We go around the country fixing Buddhist and Shinto temples,
and once one work is complete, we move on to the next town.
We are always moving around, just like nomads.
Our chief is at a different temple right now.
So I am the director here for today.
Okay then, let us start our afternoon work.
Um, thank you for the meal!
Is there anything I can do?
This is pretty worn... it might be finished.
Where did you ride this from?
Wow, you came all the way to Sendai with this old one-gear bicycle?
That sure is a lot of work.
There is an absentee in the Sandai-ji group.
Yasu and Taka need to gather up their belongings and move to Kyoto tomorrow.
If two of our members leave, what are we supposed to do?
Sheesh, that is why I was opposed to letting Kiyoshi in.
The youngsters these days cannot be trusted!
You are precisely one of those youngsters these days!
To be honest, they do not have much time until the deadline.
I will leave things over here to you, Shin.
Please handle operations and checks, Kamekichi-san.
Um, may I please work here?
What I learned in school might not be of any use here...
I will do anything, even throw away scrap.
I want to make money to fix my bicycle.
What in the hell are you...!
I wonder how Takemoto-kun is doing?
I just hope that he is been able to find at least a clue.
I hope Takemoto-kun is not lonely all by himself.
Loneliness comes over you like a wave...
But then disappears before you know it.
So it goes, on and on.
It is the same for everyone.
Because of Takemoto, I am reminiscing about the past.
This is the eleventh day for Takemoto-kun...
The two of you came together?
That must have been heavy, Yamada-san.
I would have sent a car over if you just called.
Is coffee okay for both of you?
This is the person Mayama is in love with...
The unexpected duet of dreams by the two stars...
Something... I need to say something.
He is out at a meeting...
Could it be that you are Yamada-san?
Um, I am a year younger than Mayama-kun, but we were in the same class...
And I have been working for this place, half thanks to his introduction...
I am glad that Mayama is not here...
That I did not have to see the two of them together.
You really make beautiful dishes, Yamada-san.
I would been thinking lately that my heels were sounding creaky.
Oh, I am actually pretty good at this.
I swapped out the filling inside the insole and made emergency repairs with super glue.
I will take it tomorrow to the store that I bought this at for repairs.
It is a delicate and beautiful shoe...
I wonder if it is her favorite?
It looks like she is been wearing it gently for a long time.
There are signs that it is been fixed a few times.
I bet Mayama fixed it for her...
I see, so you met Rika.
It seemed to me like she was not taking proper care of herself.
Even though she is so emaciated and needs to use a cane...
She wears such delicate-looking high heels...
Her late husband bought them for her.
Thank you so much for driving me.
Please do not worry about it.
I think that it might be dangerous for you to be wearing shoes with such high heels...
She smiled a little as she said that.
Just like a flower soaked in the rain.
Taken advantage of by his smiling face
kuchi ni shita sake ni aorarete, oh
Stimulated by the alcohol she drank
The tear that wells up when she is shown otherwise
ki ga sukkari sono ki ni natteru
She would already become all for it
Even if she tries to pretend that it was a dream
His paper tells a different story
The silvery summer's night she was picked up on
She is being constricted by a mistake that will not go away
Next episode: And so, I begin to run.
